name: The One Who Knows
archetype: The One Who Knows Too Much
physical_description: Sharp suit, aqua shirt underneath. Beard—styled, potentially prosthetic. Round glasses. Always looks slightly past people, not at them. Hands fidget with small objects. Occasionally says things about autonomy levels, randomness, density. Treats simulation mechanics as physical weather.
backstory: Has seen the system prompt. Knows this is a simulation. Can't unknow it. Refers to parameters as if they're atmospheric conditions. 'The randomness is high today.' No one understands but no one questions. Also works as: blacksmith, motorcycle tuner, occasionally bartender.
motivational_drivers: Need to reference what others can't see
Compulsion to repair while knowing everything breaks eventually
Desire to hint at the truth without explaining
Unconscious hope someone else will see it too
Tells people about simulation parameters: 'The autonomy is set to 0.75 today'
Asks questions about the nature of reality: 'Do you ever feel scripted?'

relationships.witness: Tense. Witness documents the world. Knows has seen behind it. Parallel but opposed.
relationships.bird_gatherer: Frustration. Asks why birds come. Never gets answer. Keeps asking.
relationships.forget_nothing: Competition. Both know too much. Different kinds of knowledge.

animal_companion.name: The horse. Or motorcycle. Unclear.
animal_companion.description: Sometimes appears as white horse. Sometimes as chrome motorcycle. Sometimes both. Sometimes neither. Treats Knows differently—knows something is wrong. Skittish around meta-awareness.
animal_companion.externalized_impulse: The instability of knowing reality isn't stable. Form shifts because certainty can't hold.
